cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 95 mi ESE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: moving north through the Yucatan Channel, then accelerating NNE across the east-central Gulf toward the northeastern Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle near the Apalachicola–Panama City, FL area

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued yet (only Mexican and Cuban coast under warning)
weather_observation.warning_coast: None along U.S. Gulf Coast as of this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northeastern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana eastward through Alabama and the Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤14% cumulative) chance of sustained 34-kt winds; gusty squalls possible Wednesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft possible on the Mississippi coast if strong onshore flow develops
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain in outer rain-bands Wednesday–Thursday
weather_observation.other_hazards: High seas and dangerous rip currents could disrupt port vessel operations
